text: English vocabulary lesson 20 topic road
trip here's a list of the vocabulary
we'll study take a road trip inevitable
typical vending-machine picnic table
delay beat sit in traffic
pack up hit the road let's begin
listening 1 listen and try to answer
these questions one is Jennifer talking
about traveling a short or long distance
2 is Jennifer showing a place that's
usual or unusual in the United States 3
what can one do at a rest area
I recently took a trip to my home state
of Pennsylvania
I went by car so it was a very long
drive I took my camera with me though
and I found the opportunity to use it
let me show you one place that I stopped
at when you take a long road trip it's
almost inevitable that you're going to
stop at a rest area this is a very
typical American red stop there are
restrooms vending machines where you can
get a snap and their picnic tables where
you can have punch recall what you heard
is Jennifer talking about traveling a
short or long distance
the answer is long I do mention a long
drive but I also use the expression a
road trip a road trip also suggests
traveling quite far by car recall what
you heard it's Jennifer showing a place
that's usual or unusual in the United
States the answer is usual I say that
this rest area is typical it's a typical
rest area typical means usual or common
I also say that it's almost inevitable
that you're going to stop at a rest area
when you take a long road trip
inevitable means you can't avoid it
you can't stop something from happening
rest areas really are very common along
u.s. highways so it's inevitable that
you're going to use one in fact you
don't want to avoid them
after spending so many hours in a car
you need a break recall what you heard
what can one do at a rest area I
mentioned three things using the
restrooms or the bathrooms getting a
snack from vending machines and eating
lunch at picnic tables
do you know what a vending machine and
picnic table look like here's a vending
machine and here's a picture of a picnic
table
listening to listen and try to
understand these words and expressions
delays on the highway it beats sitting
in traffic it's time to pack up and hit
the road
and sometimes there are delays on the
highway being at a rest area sure beats
sitting in traffic but pretty soon it
will be time for my family to pack up
and hit the road again recall this
phrase delays on the highway
did you understand what I meant
delays or situations or events that
force people to wait so delays on the
highway could be traffic bad weather
such as snow or fog car accidents these
are all situations that force drivers to
wait recall these expressions beats
sitting in traffic
what does sitting in traffic mean what
does the verb Beat mean in this sentence
sitting in traffic is the same as being
stuck in traffic you're in your car you
can't drive fast and you're forced to
wait because there are so many other
cars on the road
beats helps us make a comparison which
do I think is better being at a rest
area or sitting in traffic being at a
rest area I could say being at a rest
area is better than sitting in traffic
but a more conversational way to express
the same idea is being at a rest area
beats sitting in traffic you heard me
say it's time to pack up and hit the
road did you understand these
expressions
to pack up means to gather all your
things and prepare to leave for a road
trip you pack your suitcases and load
them in the car to hit the road means to
begin traveling both are conversational
expressions
listening three watch the entire video
again this time you will be able to read
the captions
I recently took a trip to my home state
of Pennsylvania
I went by car so it was a very long
drive I took my camera with me though
and I found the opportunity to use it
let me show you one place that I stopped
at when you take a long road trip it's
almost inevitable that you're going to
stop at a rest area this is a very
typical American red stock there are
restrooms vending machines where you can
get a snack and their picnic tables
where you can have lunch and sometimes
there are delays on the highway being at
a rest area sure beats sitting in
traffic but pretty soon it will be time
for my family to pack up and hit the
road again let's remember the vocabulary
that we learned in this lesson
repeat after me take a road trip

inevitable typical vending machine
picnic table delay beat sit in traffic
pack up hit the road
questions for discussion number one
would you rather take a road trip or a
train trip explain to describe typical
foods you find in vending machines in
your country 3 do you think eating at a
picnic table beats sitting and eating on
the ground explain four-hour delay is
inevitable on the roads where you live
how often do you sit in traffic 5 your
friends suggest that you all pack up and
hit the road this weekend they want you
to choose the place where will you go
and what will you take with you
